DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess safety and effectiveness of the p64 Flow Modulation Device.
DOC.brief_title: Diversion-p64 Post Market Clinical Follow-Up Study to Assess Safety and Effectiveness of the p64 Flow Modulation Device
DOC.detailed_description: Title: Diversion-p64. Device: p64 Flow Modulation Device. Study design: Prospective, multicenter, single arm Post Market Clinical Follow-Up Study. Purpose: To assess safety and effectiveness of p64. Study duration: 30 months. Sample Size: 107 patients. Number of sites: up to 20. Follow-up intervals: 3-6 and 12 months clinical and angiographic follow-up.

Known allergy to study medication, e.g. ASA, Clopidogrel, Heparin or contrast media 8. Pregnant or breast feeding women or women with childbearing potential who cannot provide a negative pregnancy test
